columns_name: If you were to install solar PV on your home or business, is your preference to:

How long have you lived in Somerville?
If a Condo, how many units are in your building?
Have you had an energy audit done in your home?
Please select any measures you have taken to reduce your energy usage.
If you own a business or commercial building, are you interested in a commercial solar program offered through the City of Somerville?
Are you interested in installing solar PV on your house?

If solar was not a good fit for your home, the City of Somerville could potentially offer a “community solar project”, where people can opt in to purchase solar shares of a solar project located inside or near Somerville, in essence retaining the same ben
If you’ve been thinking about installing solar panels, what has held you back?
Please indicate if you would like further information on the following in regards to solar panels (select any and all that you may have)
Would you be interested in a program offered through the City where Somerville residents can receive information on solar for their homes and reduced pricing for solar?
Do you rent or own your place of residence?
If you own, what type of home do you own?
Are you interested in reducing your energy use?
Would you like to volunteer on a residential solar outreach effort to get your friends and neighbors to install solar on their homes?

There are various ways in funding a community solar project. Would you be interested in purchasing shares of a community solar project where you could receive the same benefits of owning a system of your own?  Knowing you could receive the energy output f
Do you own an electric vehicle?
If no, have you considered purchasing one?

resource.name: Website Analytics
resource.description: Contains view count data for the top 20 pages each day on the Somerville MA city website dating back to 2020. Data is used in the City's dashboard which can be found at https://www.somervilledata.farm/.
columns_description: Date the page views were recorded

resource.name: Traffic Enforcement Incidents
resource.description: Contains traffic enforcement data from Somerville Police Department. Data has been anonymized to protect privacy. Data is used in the City's dashboard which can be found here: https://www.somervilledata.farm/.

resource.name: Criminal Incidents
resource.description: Contains data on selected criminal incidents from Somerville Police Department dating back to 2015. Data has been anonymized to protect privacy. Data is used in the City's dashboard which can be found at https://www.somervilledata.farm/.
columns_description: Numeric code corresponding with type of incident
Location type (S is street, B is building, I is intersection, P is park.)

resource.name: Motor Vehicle Citations
resource.description: Contains motor vehicle citation data from Somerville Police Department dating back to 2010. Data has been anonymized to protect privacy. Data is used in the City's dashboard which can be found at https://www.somervilledata.farm/.
columns_description: The speed of the vehicle (miles per hour).
Sequence number: Citations may include more than one charge. Sequence number labels the charges within one citation.
The indicated speed (miles per hour) in the zone of the incident.

resource.name: Motor Vehicle Crash Reports

resource.name: City of Somerville Weekly Payroll Gross Wages over 50k_2017
resource.description:
This dataset includes gross wages for City and School employees for calendar year 2017.

Under Massachusetts G. L. c. 66, § 10(d), an employee’s name and place of employment may be exempt from public records disclosure if the employee or a family member was a victim of an adjudicated crime or is a victim of domestic violence, including but not limited to sexual assault or rape, or provide family planning services or provide training in family planning services, or have a court order protecting you from having your name disclosed in such a manner

New and updating bicycle and pedestrian counts are available at https://data.somervillema.gov/resource/6j4n-batb and https://data.somervillema.gov/resource/3ms3-ngki, respectively.

resource.name: Assessor's Property Database FY14-FY19
resource.description:
The State Department of Revenue (DOR) has approves assessed values each fiscal year for the Somerville Board of Assessors. The assessed values and data presented reflects information available for the FY 2014-2019 actual tax bills issued January 1 of each year. Assessments for each fiscal year have an effective market date of January 1 of the preceding year.

Note that ownership information shows record owner as of January 1. However, a second line of ownership, if applicable, showing "S/O" indicates a subsequent owner who purchased the property after January 1 but prior to the following assessment. In this instance, title information including sale price, sale date, and book & page will not appear in the data base until next year.

metadata.license: Open Data Commons Open Database License

resource.name: City of Somerville Weekly Payroll Gross Wages over 50K_2019
resource.description:
This dataset includes gross wages for City and School employees for calendar year 2019 for all employees that were compensated above $50,000.

Under Massachusetts G. L. c. 66, § 10(d), an employee’s name and place of employment may be exempt from public records disclosure if the employee or a family member was a victim of an adjudicated crime or is a victim of domestic violence, including but not limited to sexual assault or rape, or provide family planning services or provide training in family planning services, or have a court order protecting you from having your name disclosed in such a manner

resource.name: Capital Investment Plan Projects FY16-26
resource.description:
The City develops annually a Capital Investment Plan (CIP), which is a document that outlines capital projects for the next ten years, including infrastructure projects, building improvements, park redesigns, and equipment purchases. It also provides a proposed schedule and identifies financing options.

This version was submitted to the Board of Aldermen in January of 2016 and will be updated in late 2016.
resource.attribution: City of Somerville Capital Projects Committee

metadata.license: Open Data Commons Open Database License

resource.name: City of Somerville Parking Permits
resource.description:
Parking permits issued by the City of Somerville Parking Department between January 1, 2017 and November 30, 2020. Each row represents a unique permit issued. Medical care permits have been removed from this dataset. 

Please note that this dataset may contain errors due to manual data input. 

If you have any suggestions about this dataset, please contact somerstat@somervillema.gov. 

Additional permit information can be found at https://www.somervillema.gov/departments/parking-department
